tit.cmt: 以下説明が続くので、英語説明を削除しました。

sen.j: 天丼（てんどん）とは、丼飯の上に天ぷらを載せた丼物の一種。
sen.e: Tendon is a bowl of rice topped with pieces of tempura.
Tendon is a bowl of rice topped with pieces of tempura.
Tendon is a bowl of rice topped with pieces of tenpura.

sen.j: 重箱に盛りつけたものは天重（てんじゅう）とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: Tendon served in a jubako, tiered food boxes, is called Tenju.
Tendon served in a jubako (tiered food box) is called Tenju.
Tendon served in a jubako (tiered food box) is called Tenju.

sen.j: 天ぷら丼（てんぷらどんぶり、てんぷらどん）が略された物であるが、現在は天丼と言う名称が一般的になっている。
sen.e: Tendon, as it is commonly called today, is an abbreviation of Tempura donburi.
Tendon, as it's commonly called today, is an abbreviation for "Tempura Donburi."
Tendon, as it's commonly called today, is an abbreviation for "Tenpura Donburi."

sen.j: 最も一般的な調理法は丼飯に数種類の天ぷらを載せて甘辛い丼汁（タレ）をかけた物であるが、タレをかけずに天ぷらを軽く煮付けてのせるものや、塩をかけるものもある。
sen.e: The most common way of making Tendon is to top a bowl of rice with a variety of tempura and pouring salty-sweet sauce over it; however, there are other methods, including flavoring the tempura instead of pouring sauce on it or just sprinkling a bit of salt over the tempura.

The most common way of making Tendon is to top a bowl of rice with a variety of tempura and pour salty-sweet sauce over it; however, there are other methods, including flavoring the tempura instead of pouring sauce on it or just sprinkling a bit of salt over the tempura.

The most common way of making Tendon is to top a bowl of rice with a variety of tenpura and pour salty-sweet sauce over it; however, there are other methods, including flavoring the tenpura instead of pouring sauce on it or just sprinkling a bit of salt over the tenpura.

sen.j: タレには主に、出汁・醤油・みりん・砂糖などをあわせたものが使われる。
sen.e: The sauce is made by mixing soup stock, soy sauce, sugar and mirin, which is sweet rice wine used for cooking.
The sauce is made by mixing soup stock, soy sauce, sugar and mirin, which is a sweet rice wine used for cooking.
The sauce is made by mixing soup stock, soy sauce, sugar and mirin, which is a sweet rice wine used for cooking.

sen.j: 天ぷらの専門店や蕎麦蕎麦屋で多く食べられる。
sen.e: Tendon is available at tempura specialty restaurants and soba shops.
Tendon is available at tempura specialty restaurants and soba shops.
Tendon is available at tenpura specialty restaurants and soba shops.

sen.j: 蕎麦屋の丼物のなかでは最高級であることも多い。
sen.e: Of all the donburi varieties, Tendon is considered the top.
Of all the donburi varieties, Tendon is considered to be the top.
Of all the donburi varieties, Tendon is considered to be the top.

sen.j: なお、天丼は三定（創業天保8年：東京都台東区浅草）が嚆矢（現在は海老・白身・掻き揚げの天婦羅を丼飯の上に載せ丼汁をかけた天丼）と言われている。
sen.e: Tendon is said have been first served at a restaurant called Sansada (Founded 1838: Asakusa, Taito Ward, Tokyo) where a bowl of rice was topped with deep-fried diced shrimp, white fish meat and vegetables with sauce poured over it.

It is said that Tendon was first served at a restaurant called Sansada (Asakusa, Taito Ward, Tokyo; founded in 1838), where a bowl of rice was topped with deep-fried diced shrimp, whitefish and vegetables with sauce poured over it.

It is said that Tendon was first served at a restaurant called Sansada (Asakusa, Taito Ward, Tokyo; founded in 1838), where a bowl of rice was topped with deep-fried diced shrimp, whitefish and vegetables with sauce poured over it.

sen.j: 天ぷらの具は材料に制限が少ないため、その種類は非常に多いが、エビ・イカ・マアナゴ・キス (魚)などの魚介類の天ぷら数種にシシトウ・カボチャ・サツマイモなどの野菜天を数種添える事が多い。
sen.e: There is very little restriction on the type of food that can be deep-fried as tempura, including seafood such as shrimp, squid, sea eel and sand borer, which are accompanied by vegetables such as deep-fried small sweet peppers, pumpkin, and sweet potatoes.

There is very little restriction on the type of food that can be deep-fried as tempura, including seafood such as shrimp, squid, sea eel and sand borer, which are accompanied by vegetables such as small, deep-fried sweet peppers, pumpkin and sweet potatoes.

There is very little restriction on the type of food that can be deep-fried as tenpura, including seafood such as shrimp, squid, sea eel and sand borer, which are accompanied by vegetables such as small, deep-fried sweet peppers, pumpkin and sweet potatoes.

sen.j: 主となる天ぷらの種類によって「海老天丼」「穴子天丼」等と呼ぶ事もある。
sen.e: Tendon is sometimes distinguished by the main ingredient; ebi-tendon is topped with shrimp, and anago-tendon is topped with sea eel.
Tendon is sometimes distinguished by the main ingredient; ebi-tendon is topped with shrimp, and anago-tendon is topped with sea eel.
Tendon is sometimes distinguished by the main ingredient; ebi-tendon is topped with shrimp, and anago-tendon is topped with sea eel.

sen.j: 精進天丼
sen.e: Shojin Tendon (vegetarian tendon)
Shojin Tendon (vegetarian tendon)
Shojin Tendon (vegetarian tendon)

sen.j: 野菜の天ぷら（精進揚げ）のみを載せた天丼。
sen.e: This is tendon topped with vegetable tempura.
This is tendon topped with vegetable tempura.
This is tendon topped with vegetable tenpura.

sen.j: 野菜天丼とも。
sen.e: It is sometimes called Yasai (vegetable) Tendon.
It is sometimes called Yasai (vegetable) Tendon.
It is sometimes called Yasai (vegetable) Tendon.

sen.j: 掻き揚げ丼
sen.e: Kakiage-don
Kakiage-don
Kakiage-don

sen.j: 名前の通りに掻き揚げを載せた天丼。
sen.e: As the name suggests, this is a tendon topped with kakiage (deep-fried diced shrimp, white fish meat and vegetables).
As the name suggests, this is Tendon topped with kakiage (deep-fried diced shrimp, whitefish and vegetables).
As the name suggests, this is Tendon topped with kakiage (deep-fried diced shrimp, whitefish and vegetables).

sen.j: 天玉丼（または天とじ丼）
sen.e: Tentama-don (or Tentoji-don)
Tentama-don (or Tentoji-don)
Tentama-don (or Tentoji-don)

sen.j: 天ぷらを親子丼やカツ丼などのように、甘辛いタレで煮て卵でとじたもの。
sen.e: Bowl of rice topped with tempura flavored with salty-sweet sauce with beaten egg poured over it.
A bowl of rice topped with tempura flavored with salty-sweet sauce and beaten egg poured over it.
A bowl of rice topped with tenpura flavored with salty-sweet sauce and beaten egg poured over it.

sen.j: お笑いの業界用語としての天丼
sen.e: Tendon as standup-comic jargon
Tendon as standup-comic jargon
Tendon as standup-comic jargon

sen.j: コントなどにおいて同じことを２度またはそれ以上繰り返すことで滑稽な効果をもたらすことを天丼と言う。
sen.e: In standup comedy acts, when the same thing is repeated twice or more for comic effect, it is called tendon.
In standup comedy acts, when the same thing is repeated twice or more for comic effect, it's called "Tendon."
In standup comedy acts, when the same thing is repeated twice or more for comic effect, it's called "Tendon."

sen.j: 天丼に海老が２本のっていることが元になっていると言われている。
sen.e: It came from the fact that tendon is usually topped with two pieces of shrimp.
It came from the fact that Tendon is usually topped with two pieces of shrimp.
It came from the fact that Tendon is usually topped with two pieces of shrimp.
